info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 23 at 2:58PM PDT until August 25 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS ZONES 605, 606, 607, 608, AND 660... .After a brief period of cooler temperatures and higher relative humidity, hot and dry conditions will return Thursday as high pressure builds back into the region. The initial concern will be gusty east winds and low relative humidity Thursday, then a disturbance aloft may trigger thunderstorms with abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM PDT FRIDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 605, 607, AND 660... The National Weather Service in Portland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM Thursday to 11 AM PDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Oregon, Fire Weather Zone 605 North Oregon Cascade Foothills and Fire Weather Zone 607 Mt. Hood National Forest West of Cascade Crest. In Washington, Fire Weather Zone 660 Extreme South Washington Cascades and Foothills. * WINDS...East 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum RH Thursday of 15 to 20 percent. Poor to moderate humidity recoveries expected Thursday night, with elevated and exposed locations only expected to recover to 35 to 45 percent by Friday morning. * THUNDERSTORMS...3 (A chance of thunderstorms). * IMPACTS...Conditions may be favorable for rapid fire spread which may threaten life and property. Use extra caution with potential ignition sources, especially in grassy areas. Outdoor burning is not recommended. Abundant lightning Thursday night into Friday morning may cause several new fire starts.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of the above conditions can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
